body_html:
@Negrodaumus
x is an array with 2 values.
In one case, these two values are each linear interpolations of two tensors a & b.
In the second case, these two values are simply b then a respectively.
These two cases produce two separately constructed computations graphs, where one has a bunch of multiplication and addition nodes, which the second doesn't.

body:
@Negrodaumus 
x is an array with 2 values. 
In one case, these two values are each linear interpolations of two tensors a & b. 
In the second case, these two values are simply b then a respectively. 
These two cases produce two separately constructed computations graphs, where one has a bunch of multiplication and addition nodes, which the second doesn't.
